newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Queensland sees higher coal exports to India.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Queensland sees higher coal exports to India.

text.p: The Queensland state government said on Wednesday that India's demand for coking coal could see that country taking more imports from Queensland coal fields.

The Indian mining sector was also looking to mining joint ventures and imports of Queensland mining technology and mining expertise, Queensland economic and trade minister, Doug Slack, said in a statement.

Slack, who was representing Queensland at the federal Government's business forum in New Delhi, said India had reduced the tariff on coal imports to 20 percent and was committed to a new policy of extending mineral exploration permit areas.
Slack said Queensland coal exports already comprised nearly 50 percent of all Australian exports to India and amounted to A$578 million annually.
"Last year's total Queensland exports to India amounted to nearly A$618 million and included coal, metalliferous ores and specialised machinery," he said.

"Speakers at the business forum were particularly encouraging about the role Queensland could play in India's economic development through increased coal imports, joint ventures and exploration," he said.
